page.title: 06Changing times in Strensall
page.content: There have been many changes in Strensall over the last{fifty years. Now there is a health centre with six doctors. The nearest doctor was at Flaxton, four miles away. And he travelled by horse to his patients. There were more shops in the village fifty years ago including two blacksmiths,two joiners,a baker,a cobbler,a tailor,a dressmaker and two grocers. There was also a post office and two public houses. In those days the grocers made the bread to sell in the shop. They bought butter and eggs from the local farmers. They often {exchanged}these for flour and other groceries that the farmers needed. The{children}were able to play in the streets because there was very little traffic. The{army band}often marched through the village of Strensall.
